title: Amazon Just Proved That ‘Oracle Can Be Displaced.’ One Analyst Explains.
text:
Oracle’s cloud business is key to the tech giant’s future, but Macquarie warns that it may be more vulnerable to customers switching to competing systems than some previously thought. A move by Amazon.com might have proven it.

The back story. Oracle shares (ticker: ORCL) are up more than 22% year to date, ahead of the S&P 500’s 19.3% gain but behind peers tracked by the Technology Select Sector SPDR (XLK), which has risen 32% in 2019. The company has been struggling to juice revenue, and the cloud is a major battleground,...
description: Macquarie analyst Sarah Hindlian reiterated a Neutral rating on Oracle, following news from Amazon that it completed its migration from some 7,500 legacy Oracle databases for major divisions including Alexa, Amazon Prime, and Kindle.
